savedRecipes.title: Cast Iron Dutch Oven Braised Chicken and Rice
savedRecipes.content:
# Cast Iron Dutch Oven Braised Chicken and Rice

This one-pot meal takes advantage of your cast iron Dutch oven's excellent heat retention and braising capabilities to create tender, flavorful chicken with perfectly cooked rice.

## Ingredients

**Main Ingredients:**
- 3-4 lbs chicken breast (from your 13 lbs available)
- 1½ cups basmati rice (from your 12 oz available)
- 0.03125 oz mushrooms, sliced thin

**Kitchen Staples:**
- 3 tablespoons olive oil (regular)
- 2 tablespoons butter (unsalted)
- 1 teaspoon kosher salt (plus more for seasoning)
- ½ teaspoon black pepper *(optional - if not available, increase other herbs)*
- 1 teaspoon dried thyme
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- ½ teaspoon garlic salt
- 3 cups chicken broth (made from bouillon cubes/paste)
- 2 tablespoons white wine vinegar
- ½ teaspoon onion salt

## Instructions

1. **Prepare the chicken** (10 minutes): Cut chicken breasts into uniform 2-inch chunks. Season generously with kosher salt, thyme, oregano, and garlic salt. Let sit at room temperature for 10 minutes.

2. **Heat the Dutch oven** (5 minutes): Preheat your cast iron Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add olive oil and let it shimmer.

3. **Sear the chicken** (8-10 minutes): Brown chicken pieces on all sides, working in batches to avoid overcrowding. Transfer browned chicken to a plate and set aside.

4. **Sauté aromatics** (3-4 minutes): In the same Dutch oven, add butter and sliced mushrooms. Cook until mushrooms release their moisture and become golden. Season with onion salt.

5. **Add rice** (2-3 minutes): Add basmati rice to the pot, stirring to coat with the mushroom mixture and toast lightly.

6. **Build the braise** (2 minutes): Pour in white wine vinegar and scrape up any browned bits from the bottom. Add chicken broth gradually, stirring constantly.

7. **Combine and braise** (25-30 minutes): Return chicken to the pot, nestling pieces into the rice. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover tightly, and simmer for 25-30 minutes until rice is tender and chicken reaches 165°F internal temperature.

8. **Rest and serve** (10 minutes): Remove from heat and let stand, covered, for 10 minutes. Fluff rice gently with a fork and taste for seasoning, adding more salt if needed.

## Cooking Notes

- **Temperature:** Start at medium-high for searing, reduce to low for braising
- **Total cooking time:** About 1 hour
- **Serves:** 6-8 people
- **Storage:** Leftovers keep well for 3 days refrigerated

## Substitution Notes

- If you want more mushroom flavor but are limited by quantity, you can create mushroom broth by adding an extra bouillon cube to the liquid
- Fresh herbs can replace dried (use 3x the amount if available)
- The small amount of mushrooms will add flavor throughout - slice them as thin as possible to distribute evenly

This recipe maximizes your Dutch oven's braising capabilities while creating a complete, satisfying meal from your available ingredients!
